intro: Adenophora stricta var. glabrior, commonly known as the smooth adenophora, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America. It features slender, upright stems that are typically hairless, giving it its varietal name "glabrior." The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually blue to purple in color, blooming in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly rough texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
